Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw two people attempting to communicate over a long distance using a string telephone.
The student can draw the string telephone device clearly, showing it uses sound to send messages between cups.
The student can depict how sound travels between the two people through the string with arrows or lines.
The student can correctly label parts of the device, like the cups and the string, demonstrating understanding.
The student can successfully illustrate why the string telephone is useful for communication over distances, like bypassing obstacles or distances where normal conversation wouldn't work.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label smaller parts or extras correctly, such as forgetting to add labels to all components (natural variation).
The student might occasionally use slightly crowded lines or arrows, making the drawing a bit cluttered, though not enough to obscure understanding (minor gap).
